com.sri.kernel.i2c
Class I2CPort

java.lang.Object
  com.sri.kernel.i2c.I2CPort
public class I2CPort
extends java.lang.Object

This class wraps the native I2C library, providing an interface to the underlying I2C bus. Its purpose is to provide input and output streams to I2C bus. This class should be acquired through the I2CManager, and not directly instantiated.

Here is an example of how an I2CPort can be used: 

    I2CPort i2c = i2cManager.getI2C();
    SMBusOutputStream os = i2c.getOutputStream();
    SMBusInputStream is = i2c.getInputStream();
    i2c.setI2CSlaveAddress(56);
    os.writeByteData(1, 5);
    int i = is.readByteData(1);
This gets an I2CPort from the I2CManager, initializes the input and output streams, sets the slave address to 56, writes 5 to register 1, and reads back register 1 to int i.

Version:
1.5
Author:
Joseph Monti, Smart Robots
See Also:
SMBusInputStream, SMBusOutputStream
